## The 1920s Fashion Revival in Modern Times

Art Deco furniture is experiencing a revival right now, and this extends beyond furniture to fashion and design. Since the 1960s, Art Deco has had other revivals, with notable resurgences occurring during different decades.

### Historical Context and Revivals

During the 1970s it also managed to garner interest thanks to the release of the 1974 film The Great Gatsby which romanticized the era and starred Robert Redford and Mia Farrow. In the 1980s the style also influenced the Italian avant-gardist Memphis Group which caused another resurgence that was later picked up by the television series Miami Vice.

### The Current 2020s Revival

The topic of the 1920s versus the 2020s has felt fairly ubiquitous since the world began creeping out of lockdown, with comparisons made by analysts, historians, and writers alike. Meanwhile, literal 1920s fashion trends trickled down to runway collections by way of opulent embellishments and nostalgic dress silhouettes.

"Clothing springs from the culture, and both the '20s and present day [are times of] recovering from trauma," historian and curator Deirdre Clemente tells TZR. "You can't overstate the role of the war on the 1920s and right now, the country is also in a state of trauma [while] trying to recover from the pandemic."

### Art Deco's Influence on Modern Design

Art Deco was all the rage in the 1920s. With more people, exclusively women, becoming more empowered, the world of fashion decided to introduce an equally daring style to the audience; art deco. Featuring geometric shapes, luxurious designs, and an avant-garde style that cannot be imitated, art deco allowed people to combine fun elements with modern silhouettes. A century later, Art Deco continues to influence fashion, and especially in the last thirty years, it has created a connection with numerous other fashion styles.

### Great Gatsby's Cultural Impact

It's thanks to influences in television and film a la HBO series Boardwalk Empire, Golden Globe winning silent film The Artist and this December's release of The Great Gatsby remake that we're seeing a revival of '20s clothing trends for spring 2012.

Even you know that The Great Gatsby was the most beautiful portrayal of the 1920s era in fashion, beauty, and industry. The Great Gatsby was highly entertaining and is considered a classic.

### Modern Fashion Trends Inspired by the 1920s

Elements of 1920s mens clothing continue to inspire today's fashion. The influence of 1920s fashion male trends extends beyond costume parties, shaping modern menswear through structured tailoring, classic patterns, and signature accessories.

All of the shimmering, shiny pieces that walked down the runways for fall felt like an homage to the Roaring Twenties, as did other forms of grandiosity. At Miu Miu, the sheer dresses delicately encrusted with teeny crystals were a highlight, as was the hand-beaded detailing at PatBo that reflected in the light like a disco ball. "Embellishment has been seeing a revival," Becker says in reference to Trendalytics data points. "The search term 'embellishment' is currently found most in the luxury market with a high search volume, which indicates we'll continue to see this evolve."

### Contemporary Art Deco in Interior Design

Art Deco interior design, synonymous with the glamor and sophistication of the 1920s, has seen a revival in recent years. This timeless style, characterized by bold geometric shapes, luxurious materials, and rich colors, continues to inspire modern interiors. For those seeking a fresh twist on this iconic look, contemporary Art Deco incorporates the signature elegance of the past while blending seamlessly with modern elements like minimalist layouts and updated color palettes. Whether you're a fan of the iconic 1920s interior style or simply looking to add a touch of glamorous home decor to your space, the modern Art Deco trends offer plenty of inspiration.

### Why the Revival Resonates Now

"Given the sense of nostalgia in the air and the reignited desire of dressing up with a nod of an extravagance, it only makes sense that the 1920s is a natural fit," Trendalytics Fashion & Beauty Trends Editor Kendall Becker states.

The enduring appeal of Art Deco is quite remarkable. We believe that it is due in part to the fact that it is a style that truly permeates every aspect of the arts giving it an everlasting quality.

The 1920s fashion revival in the 2020s represents more than just aesthetic appreciation—it reflects cultural parallels between two post-crisis eras seeking liberation, self-expression, and celebration through fashion and design.
